title: Just Jack
text:
Jack Christopher Allsopp, known by the stage name Just Jack, is an <a href="England">English</a> musician from <a href="Camden%20Town">Camden Town</a>, <a href="London">London</a>. He first came to prominence with the release of his 2007 single "<a href="Starz%20in%20Their%20Eyes">Starz in Their Eyes</a>", which reached number two on the <a href="UK%20Singles%20Chart">UK Singles Chart</a>. He has also since been known for the songs "<a href="Embers%20%28Just%20Jack%20song%29">Embers</a>", peaking at number 17, and "<a href="The%20Day%20I%20Died">The Day I Died</a>", which peaked at number 11, and the track "<a href="Writer%27s%20Block%20%28Just%20Jack%20song%29">Writer's Block</a>".
Background.
Born in Camden, Allsopp grew up listening to dance music including <a href="breakdance">breakdance</a>, <a href="electro%20music">electro</a> <a href="hip%20hop">hip hop</a> and <a href="house%20music">house</a>. An amateur breakdancer at eight, he started DJing at the age of 15 and he soon became submerged in DJ culture and UK garage.
After completing a degree in Furniture Design at <a href="Kingston%20University">Kingston University</a>, he enrolled in a community music production course, so that he could better his awareness of <a href="sampling%20%28music%29">sampling</a> and its potential for use. He went on to practice on perfecting his sound by night and to take on a series of jobs by day.
Career.
Allsopp's debut album, titled "<a href="The%20Outer%20Marker">The Outer Marker</a>", released in 2002 by the independent label RGR Records, was a collection of songs about modern life, relationships, and the pressures of social situations. The album spawned three singles "Paradise (Lost & Found)", "Snowflakes" and "Triple Tone Eyes". "Snowflakes", his first song to enter the charts at number 164, samples The Cure's song "<a href="Lullaby%20%28The%20Cure%20song%29">Lullaby</a>" from their album "<a href="Disintegration%20%28The%20Cure%20album%29">Disintegration</a>".
He did not gain fame until 2007, following his TV debut on <a href="BBC%20Two">BBC2</a>'s "<a href="Later...%20with%20Jools%20Holland">Later... with Jools Holland</a>", and then on the <a href="Channel%204">Channel 4</a> show "<a href="The%20Friday%20Night%20Project">The Friday Night Project</a>", where he performed the single "<a href="Starz%20in%20Their%20Eyes">Starz in Their Eyes</a>", which reached number two in the <a href="UK%20Singles%20Chart">UK Singles Chart</a>. The following three singles from the album "<a href="Overtones%20%28album%29">Overtones</a>", "<a href="Glory%20Days%20%28Just%20Jack%20song%29">Glory Days</a>", "<a href="Writer%27s%20Block%20%28Just%20Jack%20song%29">Writer's Block</a>" and "<a href="No%20Time%20%28Just%20Jack%20song%29">No Time</a>" did not make the top thirty. "Starz In Their Eyes" was also featured in the <a href="Dolce%20%26amp%3B%20Gabbana">Dolce & Gabbana</a> Summer 2008 fashion show, and the <a href="Xbox%20360">Xbox 360</a> <a href="Kinect">Kinect</a> game "<a href="Kinect%20Sports">Kinect Sports</a>". He also collaborated with <a href="Kylie%20Minogue">Kylie Minogue</a> on the song "I Talk Too Much", for the American release of "Overtones".
Allsopp performed at <a href="Glastonbury%20Festival">Glastonbury Festival</a>, <a href="V%20Festival">V Festival</a> and <a href="T4%20on%20the%20Beach">T4 on the Beach</a> in 2007 and again at <a href="Glastonbury%20Festival">Glastonbury Festival</a> in 2009. He also performed at <a href="Guilfest">Guilfest</a> in 2010.
He released his third album "All Night Cinema" on 31 August 2009, preceded by its first single "<a href="Embers%20%28Just%20Jack%20song%29">Embers</a>", which had its premiere on <a href="BBC%20Radio%201">BBC Radio 1</a> on 12 January 2009, and second single "<a href="The%20Day%20I%20Died">The Day I Died</a>", which became Jack's second highest charting single on the <a href="UK%20Singles%20Chart">UK Singles Chart</a>, peaking at number 11. Both singles peaked inside the top 20. The original choice for second single was "Doctor Doctor" but the single release was subsequently postponed.
In August 2011, Jack announced on Facebook "So close to finishing a 5 track EP. Just need to find a home for it..." Though later didn't feel like the final track was completed, he released a statement in November 2011 saying "A bit of background info... As some of you will know I recently finished a 4-track EP of new songs. It was going to be 5, but the last song didn't feel properly finished and didn't really work with the others. I'll save it for a later date. Most of the music was recorded at home and, for the first time, I mixed the songs myself. They are a little lo-fi and intentionally not 'radio' or 'singles'. I tried to make them sound warm and natural and intimate, basically the kind of music I would listen to myself. I haven't found a label to put them out through yet, but I wanted you to hear them anyway. The first will be up on Monday (for a few days) via a link to my Soundcloud, and the others will go up on the following 3 Mondays. Over and out." This 4-track EP was later titled "Rough/Ready" and made available as a free download on 17 April 2012 through the newly designed official Just Jack website. In September 2014, Allsopp released a new EP titled "Winning EP".
A third EP titled "Life Lessons" was released on 6 May 2016 through <a href="The%20Rocket%20Record%20Company">The Rocket Record Company</a>, his first album on a label since 2009.
He went on to release his fourth album, “What We Did Today” on 27 October in 2017. On 20 September 2019, he released a 7-track EP called "Laughing & Crying" which contained four new originals and three acoustic covers.
